intro: Aphora blodgettii, commonly known as the Blodgett's aphora, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aphora blodgettii is considered a species of conservation concern.
